page.title: 04 Fursdon House
page.content: Fursdon House has been the home of the Fursdon family for over 700 years. Walter de Fursdon came in about 1259, and his direct descendants have been there ever since. The house is Georgian in appearance having been extensively remodelled in 1732, but there are traces of a building going back to about 1600. The contents of the house include family portraits and furniture and a unique collection of everyday family items going back for 300 years. { Opening details:} Open Easter Sunday and Monday. Then from the beginning of May to the end of September on Sundays, Thursdays and Bank Holiday Mondays. Also Wednesdays in July and August. { Prices: } Adults:Â£1.60, children:Â£0.80.
